docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration today ordered drug companies to put labels on aspirin bottles warning of a possible link between the pain reliever and Reye syndrome, a sometimes fatal childhood illness. The agency issued a final regulation, to take effect in 90 days, requiring this warning label on aspirin and products containing aspirin: ''Warning: Children and teen-agers should not use this medicine for chicken pox or flu symptoms before a doctor is consulted about Reye syndrome, a rare but serious illness.''

headline.main: Aspirin Labels to Warn About Reye Syndrome
